keyword: calories in a pound of shrimp
title: Calories in a Pound of Shrimp
meta_description: Learn calories in a pound of shrimp—about 449 kcal total—with protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition facts based on cooked, peeled shrimp.
h1: Calories in a Pound of Shrimp
assumptions: Cooked (boiled or steamed), peeled, deveined shrimp; no added salt, oil, or seasonings; 1 pound ≈ 454 grams.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp type, size, cooking method, and whether fresh or frozen; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pound of cooked shrimp offers ~449 kcal and ~109 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Grilled with 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of shrimp?
faqs.a: Approximately 449 kcal for 1 pound of cooked, peeled shrimp.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a pound of shrimp?
faqs.a: About 109 g of protein, making it a high-protein, low-fat option.
Yes, only 0.9 g carbs total in a pound, with 0 g fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: What's the cholesterol in a pound of shrimp?
faqs.a: Around 885 mg, mostly from the natural composition; consult a doctor if monitoring intake.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in shrimp?
faqs.a: Yes—boiled/steamed is lowest; frying or adding oil/butter increases calories significantly.
